column3: Go to the Application admin_url supplied by the testdrive setup

column4: You are looking at a test Application created for this test

column3: Scroll down to find the ISSN (print) and ISSN (online) fields

column4: The Print ISSN field is annotated with a green tick, and text which says that ISSN is fully registered at ISSN.org
The Electronic ISSN field is annotated with an orange cross, which says the ISSN is not registered at ISSN.org

column3: Click on one of the "see record" links in the annotation

column4: The link is opened in a new window/tab
You are taken to the ISSN.org record.  Note that for the purposes of this test, this is a random record on ISSN.org, unrelated to the actual record in DOAJ.

column3: Close the ISSN.org window/tab and return to the application form
Scroll to the "Best Practice" section of the application form, and look at the "Long-term preservation services" question

column4: 4 checks are visible attached to this question, for: CLOCKSS, LOCKSS, PMC and PKP PN
CLOCKSS is annotated with a green tick, saying it is archived
LOCKSS is annotated with a red cross, saying it is not current
PMC is annotated with a grey info symbol, saying it is not currently recorded by Keepers
PKP PN is annotated with a red cross, saying it is not archived

column3: Click on one of the "see record" links in the annotation

column4: The link is opened in a new window/tab
You are taken to the ISSN.org record.  Note that for the purposes of this test, this is a random record on ISSN.org, unrelated to the actual record in DOAJ.

column3: Close the ISSN.org window/tab and return to the application form
Scroll to the top of the application form

column4: There is text which tells you when the Autochecks were made, and an option to Hide All Autochecks

column3: Click "Hide All Autochecks", then scroll through the form
Return to the top of the application form and click "Show All Autochecks", then scroll through the form

column4: The autochecks are all visible again
